definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
literature and language/(PRC) Chinese (as a school subject)
speech sounds/pronunciation/colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character/phonetic/audio/voice/(Internet) to voice chat/voice message
word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression

sentences.english: Each nationality has its own language of posture and gesture.
sentences.chinese: 每个民族都有自己的身势语和手势语。

sentences.english: Most Asians also speak English and Swahili .
sentences.chinese: 大多数亚洲人也讲英语和斯瓦希里语。

sentences.english: This is sometimes called body language.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们有时所说的身姿语。

sentences.english: What sort of farewell is that?
Tswana speakers tend to live near the border with Botswana.
sentences.chinese: 说茨瓦纳语的人一般住在博茨瓦纳边境附近。

sentences.english: Incorporate quotations of three lines or less into the text, within single quotation marks.
sentences.chinese: 文本中三行或更少的合并的引用语，用单引号。

sentences.english: Darling' is a term of endearment.
Smiling at the Dornish knights, she switched back to the Common Tongue.
sentences.chinese: 边对多恩骑士微笑，她边转换成通用语。

sentences.english: The inflated style itself is a kind of euphemism.
sentences.chinese: 这种华而不实的风格本身就是一种委婉语。

sentences.english: I'm just really sad I couldn't give my speech in Gaelic.
sentences.chinese: 我只是感到伤心不能用苏格兰语发表感言。

sentences.english: Nothing really. I'm in Slavic studies.
sentences.chinese: 随便说说，我是学斯拉夫语的。

sentences.english: Its closest relatives are Turkish and Turkmen.
sentences.chinese: 与它最接近的是土耳其语和土库曼语。

sentences.english: The source of the word, Pygmalion is ancient Greece.
Likewise, phatic language is influenced by it too.
sentences.chinese: 同样，应酬语也受之影响。

sentences.english: The Mid-Autumn night language sends to long for, spending a good month a circle a circle with difficult feeling.
sentences.chinese: 中秋夜语寄相思，花好月圆情难圆。

sentences.english: The letter bears the salutation “Dear Sir”。
sentences.chinese: 信上写有称呼语“亲爱的先生”。

definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
to express or convey one's ideas
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
to remain silent/to have nothing to say
